title: NeuralNetworkConfiguration
description: A configuration file used in training neural networks.

VariableIndexer.description: A collection of variable indices to use.

NumericIndices.description: Numerical indexing of variables (Python range formatting allowed).

VariableNames.description: Indexing of variables by their name (these are treated as regular expressions).

DataFormat.description: The format that the data should take.

ExampleIDVariable.description: The numeric index or name of the variable that is used to index the examples.

Format.description: The overall format that the data should take.

HeaderPresent.description: Whether the first row of the dataset is a header.

Separator.description: The separator between variables in the input file.

Type.description: The type of the data (ignoring any example IDs)..

VariablesToIgnore.description: The numerical indices or the names of the variables to ignore.

ProcessData.description: Configuration parameters to prepare a dataset for training a neural network.

DataSplit.description: How to split the dataset between train, test and validation sets.

TestFraction.description: The fraction of the dataset to split off into a test set.

TrainFraction.description: The fraction of the dataset to split off into a training set.

ValidationFraction.description: The fraction of the dataset to split off into a validation set.

Normalise.description: Configuration parameters for normalising a dataset.

Categorical.description: Categorical variables to convert to one-hot encoding.

OneOfC.description: Variables to convert to a one-of-C encoding, where C is the number of categories.

OneOfC-1.description: Variables to convert to a one-of-(C-1) encoding, where C is the number of categories.

MinMaxScale.description: Variables to normalise by min/max scaling.

Normalise.description: Variables to normalise by Gaussian standardisation.

Shard.description: Configuration parameters for splitting a dataset into shards.

ExamplesPerShard.description: The number of examples to save in each shard.

ShardsToGenerate.description: The number of dataset shards to generate.
